title: Single of The Week: Onra- The Anthem
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/onra.jpg "onra")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/1939-single-of-the-week-onra-the-anthem/attachment/onra)

Released in 2007, Onra’s third studio album Chinoiseries was and still is something of a marvel. Before making the record Onra went to Vietnam, where his grandparents are from, and managed to bring back some 30 old Chinese and Vietnamese vinyl records. He then made a full album with this material; Chinoiseries, which is his most critically acclaimed album.

The highlight is perhaps “The Anthem”, a piece of music that was later chosen for a Coca-Cola commercial at the Beijing Olympics. The piece is short, sharp and utterly infectious, taking influences from jazz and swing it creates a truly absorbing wall of sound layered with the most intricate of samples. Three years later and the record is just as fresh as the day it was cut. Enjoy.
